explanation: Not correct. MISRA Rule 21.17 concerns the use of <string.h> functions that can read/write beyond object bounds. The code shown (MHD_lookup_header_token_ci) does not itself call any <string.h> functions — it only calls helper functions (MHD_str_equal_caseless_bin_n_ and MHD_str_has_token_caseless_). A possible out‑of‑bounds read would be a defect in the implementation of those helpers, not in MHD_lookup_header_token_ci itself. Moreover, the MHD_HTTP_Req_Header comments state that value_size is “the length of the value, not including the final zero termination,” which documents that pos->value is NUL‑terminated; that makes passing pos->value to string routines safe in the usual C sense. Without the implementation of MHD_str_has_token_caseless_ showing use of string.h functions that ignore buffer lengths (e.g. calling strlen/strstr on non‑terminated data), the report is speculative. Therefore the claim that this function violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is not supported by the provided code.
